content:
If you're using the profile backup option, I presume the backups are being saved outside the Thunderbird profile. As such, there is no dependence whatever on Thunderbird and you do not harm in deleting some. To test a backup, - - exit thunderbird - click windows key and 'r' key - enter command exactly in this syntax: 

  thunderbird.exe  -profile  "c:\<profile location>"
creator: davidsk

content:
First, do a full backup of profile when Thunderbird not running. Next, upgrades are generally safe when upgrading to first version of a new release. That would indicate upgrading in this sequence: - 68.1 - 78.0.1 - 98.0.1 - 102.0.1 - 102.7.2 (current release)

Based on Thundernet history: https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/releases/

content:
So lets start at the beginning.

1. Account settings will list all your accounts. Looking to have a complete list of incoming accounts is something of a dream as the lists you mention simply are not lists of accounts as such.

2. Outgoing server (SMTP) in account settings will list the outgoing sever you have configured. These are the servers that accept your outgoing mail.

3. You show an image of the accounts show in unified folders. These are simple a collection of accounts used to search for mail in the unified inbox search folder. At times they do not show all configured incoming account. Right clicking the folder list and selecting properties will allow the list of incoming accounts to be edited as to what is shown.

4. You list a collection of addresses in the compose window for from. These are a simple list of identities and their associated outgoing server. In no way related to the incoming accounts in the unified inbox or the account settings

From is determined by identities. Each account can have an unlimited number of identities, the default is one, but you can keep clicking add and adding them to the extent of available memory. I suggest you look at the information on identities here https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/using-identities
creator: MattAuSupport

content: This may not be the problem, but this is a common problem I see regularly. You have six email accounts shown on one of the screenshots. That means there should be twelve entries in settings>privacy&security screenshot, yet you only show seven. My suggestion: - there should be an incoming and smtp server for each account, even when using the same server - review all six accounts to see which smtp server is supporting it. My guess is you may find the yandex smtp server is set to support a gmail account, and that creates the problem you see.
creator: davidsk

creator: harenkov

content: You can create additional SMTP server at account settings>outgoing server (SMTP) settings and click ADD button. Then be sure to have a description for each so you will know which is which when looking at server page that shows which SMTP server is assigned. I hope this is answering your question.
creator: davidsk

content: Did you mean to post this on the Thunderbird forum? This looks like a question for a Firefox forum. Incidentally, Bing is a search engine, not a browser. If the issue is that Bing is now your default search engine and you don't want that, click 'settings' in Firefox, then click 'search', then change the default search engine there.
